availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Illinois } SS
McLean County

I John N Larrimore of the city of Bloomington in the county of McLean and State of Illinois having been appointed a Commissioner in the State of Illinois for the State of Kentucky by the Governor of Kentucky to make and Execute deeds & other instruments of writing take depositions &c, do Solemnly Swear that I will faithfully and diligently perform the duties thereof to the best of my ability So help me God
Subscribed & Sworn to before me by Jno N Larrimore to me known this 22d day of July A D 1862

Wm. McCullough. clerk of the
McLean Circuit Court of Illinois
By Luman Burr. Deputy

Illinois
Comr. of Deeds
Oath
Jno. N. Larrimore
Filed July 24 1862.
Please acknowledge the receipt of money & oblige
